name: BD+48 738
scenarioDescription:
The BD+48 738 Exoplanetary System


Overview

BD+48 738 is a star with 0.74 times the mass of the Sun, and 11 times its radius. It is located 2909.87 light years away from the solar system.

BD+48 738 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the BD+48 738 system


BD+48 738 b

BD+48 738 b was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of BD+48 738 b is 289.38 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, BD+48 738 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system BD+48 738, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by McDonald Observatory.
